title: Why Clare Waight Keller's latest Givenchy collection could prove to be a stealth hit next season
text:
The world’s most expensive jeans, at least according to The Guinness Book of Record, are a Swarovski-encrusted pair from Escada that went on sale for $10,000 in 2006. History doesn’t record how many, if any, were sold, but given how freely money was flowing before The Crash, it seems inevitable a few were snapped up.

The biggest surprise, if you deal in commodities rather than fashion, is that the $10,000 ticket price hasn’t been exceeded in the years since. Hyper-inflation in blue chip accessories has seen Chanel’s 2.55 quilted bag and Hermes’ Birkin triple and quadruple in a decade.

But denim isn’t blue chip. It may be a staple in real life, but on the catwalk it waxes and wanes. Maria Grazia...
description: The world’s most expensive jeans, at least according to The Guinness Book of Record, are a Swarovski-encrusted pair from Escada that went on sale for $10,000 in 2006.
